page.title: 06SCHOOL DAYS 1985
page.content: Most children wake up at half past seven. They watch breakfast TV. The boys always come early to play football. The girls come much later and walk around the playground. When the whistle goes we come in. We put our coats and bags in the cloakroom and go down the corridor. We go in class and get our reading books out. Then we have maths. That takes us up to playtime. The boys play throw the ball, the girls walk around. After play we play a game of rounders. When we come in it is about a quarter to twelve. We get changed and go to dinner. At half past twelve we come out of the dinner hall. Play ends at twenty past one. In the afternoon we have art. At half past two it is playtime. After play we have a story then we go home.
